EVTOPTA_MNM_3880: I will provide all the support they require.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3880: We should abandon our efforts in [target_province.GetName] for now.
EVTDESC_MNM_3890: After much work, dedication and prayer, the community of [Root.GetTrueReligionAdherent]s in [target_province.GetName] has grown far larger than what it once was. Believers in great numbers share joy and hardships while ensuring their faith stays hidden from the wider world. The congregation has become a small cosmos of faithful, and new converts find the truth of [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] by the day.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3890: You all rest in the embrace of [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName]!
EVTDESC_MNM_3901:
[Root.GetSRGreeting], [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

Our community is growing steadily in the shadows, but for our ultimate goal to see the light of day we need to have the support of the local populace. You should spread our teaching in the lands of [target_province.GetName].

[Root.GetSRFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
secret_religions_prepare_grounds_desc: Order a loyal agent to secretly spread our teachings in a target province.
secret_religions_personally_adopt_secret: Give up the charade of your the false religion you've acted upon and openly declare your true faith.
secret_religions_renounce_secret_religio: You quit the practices of your secret religion and concede your faith in favor of your public religion.
secret_religions_prepare_grounds_effect_: A loyal servant is sent to found a community of the true faith in [Root.GetName]
EVTOPTA_MNM_3850: In due time these beautiful seeds will blossom.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3858: We can no longer safely operate in that area.
EVTTOOLTIP_MNM_3850: Our agent will report back about the progress of our conversion.
EVTDESC_MNM_3920: I was in the middle of a conversation with the chef when [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] appears from nowhere, grabs me by the arm and pulls me to a nearby room. With a wrinkled forehead and sweaty palms [worried_secret_member.GetSheHe] told me that [worried_secret_member.GetSheHe] intend to leave our society after being haunted too many times by shadows in the darkness.
EVTOPTC_MNM_3920: Use your soothing voice to calm [worried_secret_member.GetHerHim] down.
EVTOPTD_MNM_3920: If that's the way [worried_secret_member.GetSheHe] feels about it.
EVTDESC_MNM_3921_A: I gave a speech to [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] about the importance of solidarity for our movement. I emphasized how important every member of our society is so that we can be strong together. [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] seemed to sympathize with my speech and told me that [worried_secret_member.GetSheHe] will continue to back our cause.
EVTDESC_MNM_3921_B: I gave a speech to [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] about the importance of solidarity for our movement. I emphasized how important every member of our society is so that we can be strong together. [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] stood there unmoved by my soft words, still determined to abandon our cause.
EVTDESC_MNM_3921_C: I told [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] that this is a time of trials but that we have to endure. [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] observes us and will reward us in due time. Feeling the pressure of divine intervention [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] promised to keep our true faith for the time being.
EVTDESC_MNM_3921_D: I told [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] that this is a time of trials but that we have to endure. [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] observes us and will reward us in due time. However, [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] was still more worried about the present situation than divine judgement and ran off before I could stop [worried_secret_member.GetHerHim].
EVTDESC_MNM_3921_E: After getting [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] seated and listened to [worried_secret_member.GetHerHis] worried feelings I managed to calm [worried_secret_member.GetHerHim] down. After having ventilated most of [worried_secret_member.GetHerHis] thoughts [worried_secret_member.GetFirstName] was determined that our community and cause is something worth fighting for.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3921: One for all, and all for one!
EVTOPTB_MNM_3921: That makes one less of our meagre company.
unfaithful_rumors_desc: There are rumors about this character not being true to their faith.
EVTDESC_MNM_3910: There's a rumor about an artist in the vicinity that creates the most magnificent landscape paintings with features of human nature.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3910: I need to have one of those in my possession.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3910: Beautiful paintings. Alas, I can't afford one.
EVTDESC_MNM_3911: I got a personal unveiling of the painting I commissioned for. The artist truly did a remarkable job with it.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3911: But it feels like something is missing.
EVTTOOLTIPA_MNM_3911_FEMALE: Ask the artist to add some hidden [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] symbols.\nShe might take offence to your request.
EVTTOOLTIPA_MNM_3911_MALE: Ask the artist to add some hidden [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] symbols.\nHe might take offence to your request.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3911: I'll just add some details of my own.
EVTTOOLTIPB_MNM_3911: To the best of your skills you'll give the painting a touch of [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] symbols.
EVTOPTC_MNM_3911: This should be on display for all my prominent guests.
magnificent_painting_desc: This remarkable painting almost comes to life and brings you outdoor in nature while you're still observing it from under a roof. A truly enchanting piece of art.
EVTDESC_MNM_3912: When I showed off my latest addition to my art collection one particular person spent a long time studying the painting. Turns out that it was [society_art_observer.GetSocietyRank] [society_art_observer.GetFirstName] whom later shook my hand and discretely left a [Root.GetSRTrinketSymbol] in my palm.
EVTOPTA_3912: I'm happy to have other enlightened fellows around.
EVTOPTA_3914: I hope someone can appreciate this.
EVTOPTB_3914: I'll have to hide this catastrophe.
avant_garde_painting_desc: For good and bad, this painting has its own... unique style.
EVTOPTA_3930: That sounds like exactly what I need.
EVTTOOLTIP_MNM_3930: You disguise yourselves to visit a local watering hole.
EVTOPTB_3930: Is [society_character.GetSheHe] joking? I have so much to do!
EVTTOOLTIPA_MNM_3932: Attempt to resolve the situation diplomatically.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3932: A threat? I'll add injury to those insults!
EVTTOOLTIPB_MNM_3932: Go for a distinctly undiplomatic solution.
EVTDESC_MNM_3933_SUCCESS: It didn't take long to calm the brawler, as just a few leaps of logic was enough to convince him that our beliefs weren't so fundamentally different. After sitting together for the rest of the evening, he even reluctantly admitted that there might be something to our [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] arguments after all! Later, [society_character.GetTitledFirstName] complimented me on my theological efforts.
EVTDESC_MNM_3933_FAILURE: As it turns out, the beginning of a bar fight is not the best place for theological debate. My argument was drowned out by the shout of pain from [society_character.GetTitledFirstName] as the first punch was thrown. After that the entire tavern descended into chaos. To make matters worse, the brawler who had initiated the fight quoted lines from [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] as we were thrown on our faces into the street.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3933: I'm proud that turned out so well.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3933: It certainly distracted me from my stress at court.
EVTDESC_MNM_3934_SUCCESS: In these dark times, [Root.GetTrueReligionAdherent]s must stand up for each other. I shoved [society_character.GetTitledFirstName] out of the way of the first punch, and as the tavern descended into brawling chaos I made sure [society_character.GetSheHe] was left unharmed. In the end my fists were battered and bruised, but there was not a single person left standing who dared question me when I proclaimed the superiority of the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] faith.
EVTDESC_MNM_3934_FAILURE: Some kind of divine fury must have driven the brawler, for he turned out to be an unstoppable beast! Even as we tried to restrain him simultaneously he merely shrugged us off and let his fists fly. Soon others joined in the fight on both sides, and we crawled our way to safety. As we made our way out we could still hear praise for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] shouted over the sound of cracking wood and shattering glass.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3934: It felt good to fight in the name of [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName].
EVTOPTB_MNM_3934: [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] can prove strength by healing my wounds instead...
EVTDESC_MNM_3949: I feel the [old_religion.Religion.GetName] way of life calling to me still. My [demander.GetLordLady]'s demand for me to abandon my beliefs and never enter my [old_religion.GetHouseOfWorship] again only makes the urge stronger. I find no truth in the [demander.Religion.GetName] faith and truly doubt [demander.GetHerHis] [demander.GetHouseOfWorship] will ever be a place for me.
EVTOPTA_MNM_3949: I will stay a true [old_religion.Religion.GetName], even if I have to do so in secret.
EVTOPTB_MNM_3949: I must purge my mind of these thoughts and fully embrace [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
buddhas_tooth_desc: This is the tooth of Buddha that was once smuggled out of Kalinga. It is one of the most holy relics in existence from the Great Buddha and its custody requires the kingliest of qualities.
sarira_desc: This is a small crystal like bead that was once retrieved from the ashes of a cremated spiritual master. It is an object of some power and is believed to be able to ward off evil and convey blessings upon those that possess it.
sariraka_actual_body_part_desc: This is a bone that once belonged to the Buddha himself. They serve as Cetiya, or a reminder of the great Gautama Buddha.
EVTDESC_MNM_9200: Having received the news of [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName]'s return you hurry to the throne room. As you receive [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] presents you with a small box containing an unusually large tooth. It is with great reverence in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] voice that [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] announces: 'This is the sacred tooth of Buddha. It is the same relic that was once left in the custody of Khema, smuggled out of Kalinga by princess Hemamali and which has since been cared for by the finest kings in all of India'. To be the custodian of this relic is to exhibit the greatest of kingly virtues, it marks the divine right of the holder to rule over men. Your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] has brought you a greater prize than you dared imagine.\n\nAs you look up from the tooth itself you realize this is something that has not escaped [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] [relic_hunter.GetHerselfHimself]. A steady gaze meets yours, this is clearly the look of a [relic_hunter.GetManWoman] that expects a great reward.
EVTDESC_MNM_9201:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] and [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] expedition has returned from their search and now stand before you. In an opened box lies the largest diamond you have ever seen. 'It is known as the Mountain of Light' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] tells you, 'and it is a stone that has brought wealth, prestige and splendor to those that have owned it for centuries.'

Surely with this stone in your hands you will be the envy of every ruler alive. In truth it is as magnificent as it is terrifying, you cannot help but recall the saying that all large gemstones are cursed...

Looking up you realize [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] is and [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] companions are still here, awaiting a reward for the kingly prize they have brought you.
EVTDESC_MNM_9202: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, presenting you with a carefully wrapped Danda. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] claims that this scepter is of great age and that it has belonged to a number of ancient monarchs before you.
EVTDESC_MNM_9203: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search and brings with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small crystal-like bead. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] insist that this what remained after the cremation of a great spiritual master and that it is an object of great power.
EVTDESC_MNM_9204: My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] has returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest and brings with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a carefully packaged bone that [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] insists once belonged to the great Buddha himself.
EVTOPTA_RIP_5060: Call for my Court Physician at once!
ignore_ill_relatives_tooltip: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] won't receive any more notifications about sick relatives.
EVTOPTA_SOA_3002_SATANIST: I must protect this child of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap]!
EVTOPTB_SOA_3002_SATANIST: [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] has honored me with this child!
EVTOPTA_SOA_3039_SATANIST: The blessed child of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] is playful...
EVTDESC_SOA_3081: Odd looking strangers in exotic ships came ashore today, heralds of a great empire far to the west. Oddly enough, they claim that their new ruler came to them from this side of the ocean. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] wishes us to know that [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is coming back at the head of a vast army, promising to "bring judgment upon the false god."
EVTDESC_SOA_3082: Our great hope and savior, [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber], [From.GetSonDaughter] of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName], has gathered [From.GetPossPronoun] most devoted followers and boarded a small fleet of longships bound for the other side of the Atlantic ocean. Guided by the Great Serpent, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] promised to return at the head of a host such as the world has never seen. All the works of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] shall be cast down and [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] will rule the world forever!
EVTDESC_SOA_3083: Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber]  widely considered the [From.GetSonDaughter] of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]  has gathered [From.GetPossPronoun] most devoted followers and boarded a small fleet of longships bound for the other side of the Atlantic ocean. Defiantly embracing the role of demonic antagonist, [From.GetSubjectPronoun] has promised to subjugate the lands of the distant west and return in triumph at the head of a host such as the world has never seen...
EVTOPTA_SOA_3083: [From.GetFirstName] was never right in the head.
EVTDESC_SSI_002_DEMON: There are rumors of exotic strangers in weird looking ships making landfall all along the Atlantic coast. They claim to be heralds of a great emperor from beyond the Atlantic Ocean  a [FromFrom.GetManWoman] from our continent who crossed the trackless seas to somehow become ruler of the peoples of the sunset. This emperor [FromFrom.GetFirstName] threatens doom to all who follow "the false god of Abraham"!
EVTDESC_SOA_3090: The day of reckoning is nigh. The [From.GetSonDaughter] of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] is finally loose in the world of men! Our new [From.GetMasterMistress] will lead us to victory against the lying Creator and all his weak minions! The brothers and sisters of [GetLucifersOwnSocietyName] must stand ready to support [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber] in [From.GetPossPronoun] relentless march towards Armageddon.
EVTDESC_SOA_3092: Our [From.GetMasterMistress], the [From.GetSonDaughter] of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] [From.GetReflexivePronoun], has returned to [From.GetPossPronoun] father in Hell! The brethren are in shock, but we must not lose faith in His great plan. For reasons beyond our ken, the time must simply not have been right. No doubt the Chosen One will return in a different age, when belief in the feeble Creator deity has waned to a mere ember...
EVTDESC_MNM_20002: My [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber], was passing by and decided to pay me a surprise visit! [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] is in a lewd mood and thought we might stage an impromptu orgy in honor of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].
EVTDESC_MNM_20002_COURT: My [GetFromRelation] and [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetFirstName], is feeling lascivious and just suggested that we might stage an impromptu orgy together  in honor of the Great Serpent, of course!
EVTOPTA_MNM_20002: What a lovely idea! I'll wear my [Root.GetDWPartyClothes].
EVTOPTB_MNM_20002: No way! [From.GetPossPronounCap] debaucheries never end well...
EVT_TT_20003: Demonic orgies can be rewarding, but remember that [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] is a cruel master...
EVTDESC_MNM_20004: Where am I?! Oh yes... the orgy  three days of wicked debaucheries conducted by a Priapic dwarf from Hell. The drugs, the copulation, the succubus with the hypnotic flute... the ritual murder. Was it real? All I know is that [From.GetFirstName] sure knows how to throw a party!
EVTDESC_MNM_20004_SEX: Having indulged in at least four different kinds of exotic drugs, the last three days are a fiery haze in my mind. There was a woman with a forked tongue, a one-eyed dwarf and many other wonderful freaks  some of them might even have been real! Mmmm, and the tricks [From.GetFirstName] and I taught each other!
EVTDESC_MNM_20004_ODD_SEX: My memories of the last few days are dreamlike. There was lots of smoke, a cackling old crone and a nubile young woman with a long tail that could do all kinds of things... Oh, and there was a loud midget ordering me and [From.GetFirstName] into various interesting positions. I never realized I liked [From.GetMenWomen] that way...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20004_CANNIBAL: But most of all, my compliments to the chef!
satyric_blessing_desc: This man has been favored with the virility and animal magnetism of satyrs.
blessing_of_lilith_desc: This woman has been blessed with the sensuality and infernal allure of Lilith, Adam's first wife.
blessing_of_berith_desc: Baalberith, the demon prince of murder and chief secretary of Hell, has blessed this character with overflowing coffers.
blessing_of_azazel_desc: Azazel, the Fallen Angel of War, has blessed this character with martial prowess.
blessing_of_avnas_desc: The great demon Avnas has blessed this character with secret knowledge.
blessing_of_belial_desc: The Demon Prince of Trickery has blessed this character with charm and a glib tongue.
blessing_of_mammon_desc: Great Mammon, Prince of Hell, has blessed this character with business acumen.
blessing_of_vetis_desc: Vetis, the Tempter of the Holy, has blessed this character with a devious mind.
hallucinating_desc: This character suffers from hallucinatory episodes.
EVTDESC_MNM_20012: After a lengthy discussion about the logistics of an upcoming ritual, my [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber] stood up abruptly, a depraved grin splitting [From.GetPossPronoun] face: 'Well, I'm bored. Let's head down to the [Root.GetDWSettlement] and have some fun with the peasants!'
EVTDESC_MNM_20012_PARANOID: After discussing the details of an upcoming ritual, my [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber] stood up abruptly, a depraved grin splitting [From.GetPossPronoun] face: 'Well, I'm bored. Let's head down to the [Root.GetDWSettlement] and have some fun!' There it was  the expected attempt on my life... Good thing I've already subverted most of [From.GetPossPronoun] retainers!
EVTDESC_MNM_20012_COURT: My [GetFromRelation] and fellow [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetFirstName] and I had been discussing a small devotion to [Root.GetDWRandomDemon] when [From.GetSubjectPronoun] suddenly stood up, stretched and said: 'I'm in the mood for mayhem! Let's dress up and head down to the [Root.GetDWSettlement].'
EVTOPTB_MNM_20012: I don't want to risk riling up the rabble.
EVT_TT_20013: Demonic outings can be rewarding, but remember that [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] is a cruel master...
EVTDESC_MNM_20014: Wearing nondescript common clothes, [From.GetFirstName] and I are slowly making our way to town in amicable silence. As we pass by a neatly kept garden in front of a cozy-looking house, I am suddenly overcome with hatred and revulsion. This family is clearly favored by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]...
EVTDESC_MNM_20014_NOMAD: [From.GetFirstName] and I are riding down to the camp at a lazy trot. As we pass by some children playing in front of an impressive yurt I am suddenly overcome with hatred and revulsion. This family is clearly favored by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20014: Keep going. They get to live... for now.
EVT_TT_20015: You picked the wrong neighbor, my friends...
EVTDESC_MNM_20015: The father of the family died last. Ah, but the marvels he got to see first! [FromFrom.GetFirstName] carved the wife's face off and pranced around wearing it as a mask, taunting and kissing the man while I boiled baby fat to make a flying potion. Finally, we constructed an idol of [Root.GetDWRandomDemon] from the dismembered bodies.
EVTDESC_MNM_20015_DEATH: The father broke free just as we were putting out the eyes of the oldest girl. Somehow, the man got hold of a huge pestle and managed to brain [FromFrom.GetFirstName] before I could cut him down! [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] must have been displeased with [FromFrom.GetFirstName], but I honored [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] by using parts of [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] for the idol of [Root.GetDWRandomDemon] I built with the bodies...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20015: Burn it all, no one must know!
EVT_TT_20016: The locals will surely be... upset.
EVTDESC_MNM_20016: Predictably, the local populace didn't appreciate the glorious monument of flesh that we left for them to find. Rumors are running rife and it won't take much for the whole of [Root.Location.GetName] to erupt into open rebellion.
EVTOPTA_MNM_20016: Ignorant scum. [Root.Location.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] will not save them...
EVTDESC_MNM_20017: Predictably, the populace of [Root.Location.GetName] didn't appreciate the glorious monument of tortured flesh that we left for them to find. In fact, they were so riled up that they've taken up arms against their rightful rulers!
EVTOPTA_MNM_20017: Playtime is over. I will show them REAL horrors!
EVTOPTA_MNM_20017_OTHER: I can hear the laughter of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. I have done well!
EVTDESC_MNM_20021: The tavern was packed when we arrived. [From.GetFirstName] distracted the tavern keeper while I dosed the barrels with '[Root.GetDWDrug]'. An hour later, the mood was getting festive. Two hours later and the crowd had descended into utter madness. [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] knows what they saw while we were offering up the staff to [Root.GetDWRandomDemon].
EVTDESC_MNM_20021_RIVALRY: The tavern was packed when we arrived. [From.GetFirstName] distracted the tavern keeper while I dosed the barrels with '[Root.GetDWDrug]'. An hour later, the mood was getting festive. That's when [From.GetFirstName] decided to play a prank on me, locking me into a room with three burly warriors who were starting to rave and hallucinate...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20021: Amusing. On to the next place, [From.GetFirstName]?
EVTOPTA_MNM_20021_OOPS: Err, I just drank the beer, didn't I?!
EVT_TT_20022: That drug can ruin the mind permanently!
EVTDESC_MNM_20022: When I came to, [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was long gone... so much for fellowship. Uuuh, I can't think straight. Where am I?
EVTDESC_MNM_20032: For some time now, my [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber] and I have been researching the proper ritual for invoking a certain [Root.GetDWDemonTerm]. A few weeks back, our kin managed to procure an ancient clay tablet with the missing incantation. We stand ready now to attain powers undreamed of by mortal [Root.GetMenWomen]...
EVTDESC_MNM_20032_COURT: For some time now, my dear [GetFromRelation] and [From.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], [From.GetFirstName] and I have been researching the proper ritual for invoking a certain [Root.GetDWDemonTerm]. A few weeks back, our brethren managed to procure an ancient clay tablet with the missing incantation. We stand ready to attain powers undreamed of by mortal [Root.GetMenWomen]...
EVT_TT_20033: Summoning rituals of this magnitude carry serious risks...
EVTDESC_MNM_20034: Our coven surrounds the summoning circle, the correct symbols drawn, the fatty candles burning a sickly green. [From.GetFirstName] intones the final invocation just as I offer up the sacrifice... Distracted by the spurting blood, at first I don't notice the man standing in the circle like he was there all along. Looking straight at me with a smirk, he says 'Bravely done, child! You have no understanding of the forces you are meddling with, but I did find your sacrifice pleasing. Quid pro quo  name your desire, [Root.GetBoyGirl]...'
EVTOPTA_MNM_20034_DISASTER: Our coven surrounds the summoning circle, the correct symbols drawn, the fatty candles burning a sickly green. [From.GetFirstName] intones the final invocation just as I offer up the sacrifice... but I bungle the cut and the drugged child starts screaming. The dagger slips from my bloody hands when I hear the insane laughter issuing forth from the circle: 'Pathetic cattle! You are playing with forces you cannot comprehend! Learn your place!' Pandemonium erupts as a fiery figure flashes into being and then starts to fade away. Some brethren start crying or shrieking, others try to kill each other. One sister is trying to poke her own eyes out right in front of [From.GetFirstName], who just stands there, drool running down the corner of [From.GetPossPronoun] mouth.
EVTOPTA_MNM_20034_EXPOSURE: We won't be able to keep this a secret...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20034_POSSESS: The laughter... it's in my head now!
EVTDESC_MNM_20035: While enjoying a quiet snack in my study, I suddenly felt an irresistible urge to jump out the window. Just like in a dream, I walked over and did it.
EVTDESC_MNM_20043: [FromFrom.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber], my [FromFrom.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType], wants me to join [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] for a lark over in [From.GetName]. There is a certain [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] and would-be witch hunter who has been a thorn in our side for some time. It is time to teach the arrogant fool a lesson in manners...
EVTDESC_MNM_20043_COURT: My [GetFromFromRelation], [FromFrom.GetFirstName], wants me to join [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] for a lark over in [From.GetName]. There is a turbulent [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] there who has been antagonizing [Root.Society.GetName] for quite some time. It is time to teach the arrogant fool a lesson in manners...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20043: Time to dust off my acting skills!
EVT_TT_20044: That is outside my Realm so we can safely stir up some real trouble!
EVTDESC_MNM_20045: We found the zealous [FromFromFrom.Religion.GetPriestTitle] in [FromFromFrom.GetName], praying in seclusion. [From.GetFirstName] snuck up from behind and gave the fool a hard kick in the head. As I gave a devotion to [Root.GetDWRandomDemon], [From.GetFirstName] proceeded to relieve [From.GetReflexivePronoun] on the comatose preacher. Then the butchery commenced...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20045: Tour the countryside, masquerading as the [FromFromFrom.Religion.GetPriestTitle].
EVT_TT_20046: With baggy clothes and enough grime on the face, one of us can probably manage a passing likeness...
EVTOPTB_MNM_20045: Host a decadent feast in the idiot's name!
EVT_TT_20047: We shall discredit the local clergy with a party that will live in infamy!
EVTDESC_MNM_20048: Masquerading as the dead [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] and attendant, we have been riding between every [Root.GetDWSettlement] and market in [From.GetName], preaching the 'Word of [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]' to the masses. Eager ears are picking up on our revolutionary message  the path to salvation requires self-indulgence and the rejection of so called authorities  especially the clergy!
EVTDESC_MNM_20049: [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and I staged a lavish feast in the abode of the dead [FromFromFrom.Religion.GetPriestTitle], taking care to only invite dignitaries who weren't well acquainted. The guests were shocked at the dancers, the half-naked musicians and the heady smoke from exotic 'incense', but when we brought in the prostitutes half the guests stood up and left  the other half were delighted!
EVTOPTA_MNM_20049: What will people think of your servants now, [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]!?
EVTDESC_MNM_20052: My compatriot in the recent escapade to [FromFromFrom.GetName], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], seems to have played a prank on me. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] appears to have told [local_ruler.GetTitledName] that I was behind the rabble rousing.
EVTOPTA_MNM_20052: We'll see who gets the last laugh, [From.GetFirstName]...
EVTDESC_MNM_20053: I just learned that my neighbor, [From.GetTitledName], has been stirring up the rabble in [local_province.GetName] with heretical nonsense!
EVTDESC_MNM_20061: My nights are plagued by terrible nightmares featuring the vile [dw_buddy.GetBestNameWithoutRegnalNumber], my rival [dw_buddy.GetSisterBrother] in [Root.GetDWBrethrenType]. [dw_buddy.GetSubjectPronounCap] howls and roars at me to the tune of infernal bagpipes while [Root.GetDWRandomDemon] looks on, bellowing with laughter. I am sure that [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] is sending me these dreams for a reason... I must prove myself worthy or be discarded as a weakling  such is the way of [Root.Society.GetName].
EVTOPTB_MNM_20061: No, dreams are just meaningless nonsense.
EVT_TT_20062: [This.GetSubjectPronounCap] will think this is an offer of reconciliation, but I'll have [This.GetObjectPronoun] scream for real...
EVTOPTC_MNM_20062: Pretend to walk into this trap...
EVT_TT_20064: My treacherous rival is in for a very nasty surprise!
EVTDESC_MNM_20063: My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], declined my offer to lay our differences aside and have some harmless fun together. The [GetRootFromInsult] must have sensed my true intentions...
EVTDESC_MNM_20064: As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] arrived for our meeting, my servants threw a sack over [From.GetObjectPronoun] and beat the [GetRootFromInsult] into submission. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] is now snugly stowed into a brazen bull that I had built especially for this occasion. Surrounding the bull are some crucified scum from my dungeon, drenched in oil.\n\nIt took some work to find three genuinely insane musicians, but as they start up their demented tune and the fires are lit underneath the bull, I lean back and realize it was all worth it. As soon as the first bellows start issuing forth from the bull, I order the human candles lit. I close my eyes and hum along with the infernal choir, my nightmares conquered once and for all...
EVTOPTA_MNM_20064: These are the pleasures that await us all in Hell!
EVTDESC_MNM_20065: As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and I were making our way down to the [Root.GetDWSettlement] along a darkened trail, someone suddenly threw a sack over me and I was mercilessly pummeled until I lost consciousness. When I came to, I was hogtied and lying on the cold ground. My blindfold was roughly pulled off and I beheld a great brazen bull with firewood stacked underneath! Hooded characters forced me inside, with my mouth near a funnel of some kind. The hatch closed and soon I could hear demented music and chanting as the bull started to heat up. Please, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], forgive me. Save my soul!
EVTDESC_MNM_20067: As [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and I were making our way down to the [Root.GetDWSettlement] along a darkened trail, someone threw a sack over me and knocked me about a bit. Playing along with the charade, I was whisked away and switched for another bundled up victim...\n\nLater, I watched from the shadows as [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] staged a demented musical ritual. [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronounCap] had brought an actual brazen bull, just like the one built for the Tyrant of Akragas in ancient times. Believing me to be inside, the [GetRootFromFromInsult] ordered the flames lit. With the bull heating up, oil was poured over a bunch of crucified prisoners and set on fire  human candles screaming in accompaniment to the bellows issuing forth from the bull. The fool never realized [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] was cooking [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] own [GetFromFromVsFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName]!
EVTDESC_MNM_20068: What is this box doing on my desk? Let's look inside... it's a bright white skull, gleaming like a jewel. Hmm, and there's a note: 'I really enjoyed the prank you tried to pull on me the other night! Good thing I wasn't actually in that bull... but, have you seen your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] lately?  Your old friend, [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].'
EVTDESC247: You have increased your Martial skill (§G+1§!) while leading troops in battle in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§!.
EVTDESC20410: Your [Root.GetMyMarshalName], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], has initiated a massive recruitment drive in §Y[From.Location.GetName]§!.
EVTDESC20200: Your [Root.GetMyTreasurerName], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], has collected a special tithe in §Y[From.Location.GetName]§!.
EVTDESC20212: Your [Root.GetMyTreasurerName], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], was wounded by angry peasants while collecting taxes in §Y[From.Location.GetName]§!!
EVTDESC20213: Your [Root.GetMyTreasurerName], [From.GetTitledName], was killed by a mob of angry peasants while trying to collect the extra taxes you had ordered.
RIP.11557.d: You've regained some of the weight you lost  the food shortage is finally over!
REALM_CHAR_PERCENT_TRIGGER: At least $VAL|Y$% of characters in the realm that:
REALM_CHAR_PERCENT_NOT_TRIGGER: Less than $VAL|Y$% of characters in the realm that:
fix_holding_with_dead_owner_desc: The previous owner of this [Root.GetHolding] has been dead for some time now. Time has come to rid the place of this foul spirit!
foolish_behavior_desc: This character made a fool of [GetHerselfHimself].
sword_tier_1_desc: A common sword type worn by many in battle.
sword_tier_2_desc: A longsword of fine steel. A capable sword that will inflict great damage on its foes.
sword_tier_3_heartseeker_desc: A high quality sword, known as Heartseeker. Named after its ability to pierce any armor, it is sure to bring enemies to a swift fate.
sword_tier_3_vengeance_desc: Forged with the finest steel available, the sword was named Vengeance, to bring certain doom to any traitor.
sword_tier_3_fury_desc: A great and magnificent sword known as Fury. Swift in hand-to-hand combat as well as battle, it is sure to bring victory to the one who wields it.
scimitar_tier_1_desc: A scimitar of finer quality than your common blade.
scimitar_tier_2_desc: A well-forged blade that can stand against most weapons.
scimitar_tier_3_golden_desc: Named The Golden Scimitar, it is a weapon of exceptional quality forged by a master craftsman. The handle is adorned with ornaments made of gold and jewels.
scimitar_tier_3_fortune_desc: A blade of the finest steel and a handle inlaid with gold. Named the Scimitar of Fortune, it is said to bestow the owner with luck.
scimitar_tier_3_conquest_desc: Forged by the best of craftsmen, the Scimitar of Conquest is a blade of victory and triumph. Both handle and hilt are covered in diamonds.
lance_tier_1_desc: A wooden lance with a metal tip attached, used by cavalry in combat.
lance_tier_2_desc: With a longer lance, you can keep your distance from the enemy while still being able to strike a lethal blow.
lance_tier_3_impaler_desc: A heavy lance named The Impaler. The weight alone will allow it to impale any lightly armored opponent during a charge.
lance_tier_3_trident_desc: Named The Trident, this lance is equipped with a long and heavy metal tip of the finest steel.
lance_tier_3_piercer_desc: Crafted to be long, yet sturdy, The Piercer will make short work of any enemy foolish enough to stand in your way.
axe_tier_1_desc: A small and well-crafted axe commonly used in both melee combat and for throwing.
axe_tier_2_desc: A larger battle axe is able to give more cleaving power, making it more effective against armored foes.
axe_tier_3_cleaver_desc: A mighty battle axe named Cleaver. The size alone will make it easy to shred your opponents with a single strike.
axe_tier_3_ravager_desc: A long double bladed axe named Ravager. Crafted with high quality steel, the axe will wreak havoc among your enemies.
axe_tier_3_marauder_desc: Named Marauder, this exceptionally light weighted and well-crafted battle axe allows you to lay waste to your enemies without getting exhausted yourself.
mace_tier_1_desc: A mace made of an iron head mounted on a wooden shaft.
mace_tier_2_desc: A mace forged entirely out of iron that allow for more powerful blows.
mace_tier_3_foe_hammer_desc: The Foe Hammer is a gigantic and well-balanced two handed mace that will make short work of any foe, armored or not.
mace_tier_3_bone_breaker_desc: Known as The Bone Breaker, this two handed mace has a large and heavy head able to crush all opponents with its weight.
mace_tier_3_shatterer_desc: A large mace with spikes mounted on the head, named The Shatterer. For it will shatter your enemies, in both mind and body.
bow_tier_1_desc: A bow made from a single piece of fine wood.
bow_tier_2_desc: Composite bows are constructed with a wooden core, glued together with horn and sinew. Allowing for a smaller bow with greater power.
bow_tier_3_silent_wind_desc: A composite bow of the highest quality. It is named Silent Wind for being able to silently dispatch enemies.
bow_tier_3_lightning_desc: Named Lightning, this bow fire arrows with incredible force. Killing opponents in an instant.
bow_tier_3_eagle_desc: Known simply as Eagle. This exceptional bow can strike enemies at great distances with considerable precision.
EVTOPT_MAJOR_ARTIFACT_DUTY: Divine relic or not, finding artifacts is what I pay [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] for!
EVTOPT_MAJOR_ARTIFACT_MONEY: I will ensure [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] swims in money!
EVTOPT_MAJOR_ARTIFACT_PRESTIGE: Everyone shall hear of [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] legendary achievements!
EVTOPT_MEDIUM_ARTIFACT_DUTY: Though an impressive find, finding artifacts is what I pay [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] for!
EVTOPT_MEDIUM_ARTIFACT_MONEY: I will ensure [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] is richly compensated!
EVTOPT_MEDIUM_ARTIFACT_PRESTIGE: Everyone shall hear of [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] impressive achievements!
EVTOPT_MINOR_ARTIFACT_DUTY: Finding artifacts is what I pay [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] for!
EVTOPT_MINOR_ARTIFACT_MONEY: I will ensure [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] is suitably rewarded.
EVTOPT_MINOR_ARTIFACT_FAVOR: [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has earned my favor, I suppose.
EVTDESC_MNM_9600: [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a most remarkable, exquisite horn. It produces a tone unmatched in volume, instilling courage in the hearts of all who hear it. Could this be the Gjallarhorn of myth?
EVTDESC_MNM_9602:
Proudly, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] strides into your throne room. With a flourish of [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] cloak [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] produces a heavy hammer from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] belt, placing it head-first at [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] feet. Kneeling before it, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] solemnly proclaims: 'I have recovered the hammer of Thor, the Thundergod, himself!'

As you reach down for it you notice that it looks strange  unlike any craftsmanship you have encountered in your realm thus far. The haft is obviously shorter than it was intended to be, and as your fingers touch it is not hard to convince yourself of the surge of power coursing through your body. Surely this means you were meant to wield it!

Looking up, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] still waits for you to speak...
EVTDESC_MNM_9603:
Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] long travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes up to you and pulls out a small, carefully-wrapped package from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] clothes. With an awe-struck gaze [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] removes the cloth wrapping and reveals a piece of strangely-formed bark.

'I have found the spirits of our ancestors...' [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] whispers reverently, handing it to you. Turning it the right way up, you immediately understand what [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] means. The bark has clearly taken the shape of not just one, but three distinct visages, each staring ominously into your soul. You can sense the connection with your forebears... And the power they no doubt offer you over others.

[relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has truly proven [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] worth today.
EVTDESC_MNM_9604:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] gently places a large box on the floor before you. As [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] men proceed to break it open, a single gold coin rolls falls to the floor through one of the box's widening cracks. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] picks it up and hands it to you, smiling brightly. 'I have found you the Mill of Fortune!'

In the opened box you see a very well-made quern, and your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] continues [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] explanation. 'This is not the first time we have found coins near the Sampo on our way back here. Flour and salt, too... It seems one's fortunes increase just by being near it.'

Rolling the coin on your knuckles you ponder the importance of this find. [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] may have found you the means to create wealth from nothingness itself...
EVTDESC_MNM_9605:
The gathering of thick thunderclouds overhead accompanies [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName]'s' return to your court, and, drenched, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] kneels before you in your throne room, holding up a large axe for you in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] hands. 'The axe, my [Root.GetLordLady], of Perun Himself...'

As you rise and step towards [relic_hunter.GetHerHim], you see the axe's fine quality, and the bolts of lightning clearly visible on the sides of the axe-head. You reach for it, and just as you grab hold and lift it from your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle]'s hands a thunderclap can be heard in the distance. Surely this is a good omen!

Holding the imposing axe as if you were born to it, you look down at the awe-struck [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] who brought it to you...
EVTDESC_MNM_9606:
A proud [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] enters your throne room, a huge weapon on [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] shoulder. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] bows, and when [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] holds out the weapon you see it is a huge two-handed axe, the head of which is crafted out of stone... 'My search has been long and difficult,' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says, 'but what I bring you can be no other than the axe wielded by Perkunas himself!'

You take the axe and inspect it. It does indeed bear a striking resemblance to the description you've heard of it, from legend. It feels heavy and powerful in your hands, and though it might not be the perfect weapon in combat you definitely exude an air of authority around you while you wield it...

Your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], at least, seems impressed, as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] waits for you to speak.
EVTDESC_MNM_9607:
Paired with a brief, but heavy downpour, a drenched [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] lengthy travels. Once in your presence, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] produces a small box, and opens it to reveal a beautiful, strange stone. With a broad smile [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] hands it to you. 'This... This stone is the Rain Stone... The Yada Tashy. It must be! Rain has followed our every step...'

You hold the stone in your hand, and ponder the earlier downpour's sudden onset. It makes sense! And with this stone, your lands' crops are all but assured to grow well. Other than the obvious benefit in food production, this should also make you more popular among your subjects.

The [relic_hunter.GetManWoman] who made it possible smiles at your elation, waiting patiently...
EVTDESC_MNM_7801: The time has come to end my wedlock with [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]: if not before [dark_divorce_spell_caster.Religion.GetHighGodName], then before [dark_divorce_spell_caster.GetDWDevil]! Secluding myself, I pray and chant within the confines of the symbols I prepared on the floor. Holding a lock of [dark_divorce_target.GetFirstName]'s hair in my hand, only a few more spoken lines are needed to complete the ritual...
EVTNAME_MNM_9804: The Remains of the First Pope
EVTDESC_MNM_9804:
At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find a powerful artifact. Holding a small metal box, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] appears before you and, bowing, offers it to you. 'My [Root.GetLordLady], I have searched far and wide, and have found you the bones of Saint Peter, himself!'

Opening the box to sate your curiosity, you indeed find the aged bones and skull of a man, packed in the small space of the container. Properly protected from the elements, it is likely that they will continue to survive for a long time to come. And so long that they do, they will be sure to improve the Christian world's disposition towards you.

Seemingly expecting for you to speak, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently before you.
EVTDESC_MNM_9805: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an intriguing piece of clothing. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] gives me a seamless, finely-woven tunic, which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims is none other than the one Jesus wore before his crucifixion!
EVTDESC_MNM_9806: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small, ornate metal box. Within it lies a old woven crown of a particularly prickly plant... Surely this must be the Crown of Thorns Jesus himself wore on the cross!
EVTDESC_MNM_9807: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box, within which lies a single, large, old-looking nail. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures me that this is an ancient fragment of the True Cross! This will surely improve my standing in the Christian world.
EVTDESC_MNM_9808: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned carrying a small box. Inside it I find a small piece of preserved skin, which my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] ensures is none other but the prepuce of Jesus himself!
EVTDESC_MNM_9809: [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box containing a single fingerbone. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] ensures me that it belonged to a saint, and that therefore it is most prestigious to possess it.
EVTNAME_MNM_9810: The Staff of the Sixth Day
EVTDESC_MNM_9810:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, bearing a seemingly ordinary shepherd's staff. Holding it delicately, and clearly treating the simple object with devout respect, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] hands it to you. 'I have found you the staff held by Moses, which split the Red Sea and produced water from naught but rock.'

Indeed, once you hold it is not hard to recognize it for the remarkable object that it is. Created by God Himself on the Sixth Day of Creation, he who holds it is sure to have God's favor!

Smiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the staff's potential power creep onto your face, [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.
EVTDESC_MNM_9811:
Followed by one of [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] men, who carefully carries a beautiful harp, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] long search. With a broad smile, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] gives a sign for the man to hand you the instrument.

'What you hold in your hands, my [Root.GetLordLady], is what I have determined to be the actual harp played by King David, himself.' Running your fingers over the strings, the sound is almost divine! To have a talented musician play this instrument would undoubtedly put even the most cantankerous of visitors in a good mood.

You highly doubt it would work on [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] if you made [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] leave without a reward, though...
EVTDESC_MNM_9814: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a small jewelry box within which lies a small, engraved, brass and iron signet ring. Its seal, I discover, is a Star of David, and my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says that all signs point towards this being the seal of King Solomon, himself!
EVTDESC_MNM_9820:
Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] artifact hunt, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands you a small ebony box. Within it, you find a crystal-encased, ivory-bordered seal.

'This is the seal used by the Prophet Muhammad', your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says as you inspect the beautiful object. 'It must be, for it matches all depictions we have of the seal used on Muhammad's letters.' Not only will the Muslim world now surely look up to you, but you can henceforth also claim to write with the authority of Muhammad, himself!

Your [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits as you gaze at the seal, clearly expecting a reward...
EVTDESC_MNM_9821:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes before you, proudly carrying a large, inspiring banner. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] does not need to speak for you to recognize it, for it has all the necessary signs allowing you to readily identify it as Muhammad's personal standard.

With it, you will not only be an inspiration to the men under your command, but also to the Muslim world as a whole. Holding it in your hands, you feel the connection to the Prophet, and you know that your men will fight like lions wherever it is seen.

As draw your gaze away from it, you see your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] is still standing there, waiting...
EVTDESC_MNM_9822:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by two men who carry a heavy, ornate gold box, which they place on the floor before you. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me the Blessed Mantle  a gift from the Prophet Muhamad to the poet Zuhayr.'

Opening the box, you find the Mantle wrapped in forty pieces of richly-decorated cloth. The mantle itself is a beautiful buttoned white coat made from goat hair, sure to increase your standing in the Muslim world.

Pleased, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] waits for you to speak...
EVTDESC_MNM_9823: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a beautiful sword. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it is one of the Prophet Mohammad's nine swords! Not only is it a finely-crafted blade, but it should also make men more eager to follow me in battle.
EVTDESC_MNM_9824: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box within which lies an ancient piece of parchment  a letter addressed to an ancient foreign ruler. Age has not worn the letter past legibility, and so it is possible to clearly identify the signature of the Prophet Mohammad, himself!
EVTDESC_MNM_9825: [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small glass reliquary. Inside, one can clearly see a single hair, which my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] claims is a hair from the beard of the Prophet Muhammad, himself!
EVTDESC_MNM_9826: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a richly-decorated flask filled with some kind of liquid. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], this is a flask of rose water that has been infused with holy power by dipping a single button of the Blessed Mantle into it. It purportedly has miraculous qualities!
EVTDESC_MNM_9830:
At long last, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] quest to find a powerful artifact. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] reaches in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] satchel and produces a beautiful golden cup, which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] hands to you.

'This can be no other than the Cup of Jamshid from myth,' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says, 'drink from it and the truth of this world and all seven heavens will be yours!' The significance of this find sinks in as you hold the cup and listen to your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle]'s words... Properly utilized in a ritual of divination, this cup could indeed, if the legends are to be believed, provide you with the answers to many questions.

After a short while you realize [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] is still waiting...
EVTDESC_MNM_9831:
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes before you, proudly carrying a large coat made of leopard-skin. Handing the garment to you reverently, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] explains: 'After a long and arduous search, I have recovered the Babr-e Bayan  Rostam's legendary coat!'

Despite Rostam wearing it in many a war, you find no damage whatsoever on the dark-colored garment as you inspect it. This can only be interpreted as proof of its legendary invulnerability! Donning it yourself would certainly make you much less likely to come to harm in personal combat.

As you ponder this find's implications, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] is seemingly waiting for a reward...
EVTDESC_MNM_9832: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! The Derafsh Kaviani, long thought to have been lost and destroyed when the Muslims invaded the Sasanian Empire, seems to have survived, and has now returned to its rightful Zoroastrian holders! This leather banner, in red, purple and gold, will hang beautifully in my throne room.
EVTDESC_MNM_9833: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a box containing a small sapling of a strange bush. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] is convinced that this is a sapling that has sprouted from the divine Haoma bush, and surely, based on its strange looks, it cannot be anything else!
EVTDESC_MNM_9834: [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large, beautiful cypress branch. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] tells me that this is a branch of the mighty cypress tree that Zoroaster himself planted in Keshmar! Perhaps an equally mighty tree will sprout from it, here.
iron_crown_of_lombardy_desc: This jeweled circlet of gold has a central band of iron that was beaten out of a single Nail of the True Cross. It has been used for the coronations of the kings and queens of Lombardy, since.
shroud_of_jesus_desc: The burial shroud that Jesus was wrapped in upon his death. It still bears the clear image of a man, including a hauntingly-real imprint of a face.
spear_of_destiny_desc: The spear that the Roman soldier Longinus thrust into the side of Jesus, as he hung from the cross, to ensure that Christ was dead. The miraculous combination of blood and water flowed from the wound and coated the lance.
holy_grail_desc: The chalice Jesus used at the Last Supper. Said to have contained the Blood of Christ after being taken down from the cross, it must surely possess magical powers!
holy_chalice_desc: The chalice Jesus used at the Last Supper. Said to have contained the Blood of Christ after being taken down from the cross, it must surely possess magical powers!
fragment_of_true_cross_desc: A nail of the cross Jesus was crucified upon. To possess such a fragment of the True Cross is tremendously prestigious!
bones_of_st_peter_desc: This small iron box contains the remains of the apostle Peter, himself, by some considered to be the First Pope. To possess it is to be the envy of the Christian world.
holy_foreskin_desc: The foreskin of Jesus Christ, cut and placed in an alabaster box of spikenard oil on the 8th day after his birth, so that it might be preserved. Thus, it is the only body part of Christ remaining on Earth, after his ascension into Heaven.
crown_of_thorns_desc: The crown of thorns that Jesus wore during his crucifixion. Once intended to mock Jesus' claims of divine authority, it now has become a symbol of precisely that.
seamless_robe_of_jesus_desc: The woven tunic that Jesus wore before his crucifixion. Rather than divide it into four parts, like Christ's other garments, the tunic was without seams, and so was kept whole by the soldiers who had crucified him.
staff_of_moses_desc: The staff given to Moses by God, who had created it on the Sixth Day of Creation. It performed many miracles, such as splitting the Red Sea, producing water from rock, and possessing the ability to turn into a cobra.
davids_harp_desc: King David of Israel, before becoming a king, was an accomplished harpist at the court of King Saul. This is the harp he played, and even after all these centuries it is still a remarkable instrument.
seal_of_solomon_desc: This engraved, brass and iron signet ring sports the Seal of Solomon: a hexagram or Star of David. According to legend, it allows its possessor to command demons!
ark_of_the_covenant_desc: The Ark, crafted out of shittim wood at God's direction, containing the stone tablets of the Ten Commandments and a pot of manna.
blessed_mantle_desc: The white mantle of goat's hair given by the Prophet to the poet Ka'b bin Zuhayr. It was later sold by his children to Muawiyah I, the founder of the Umayyad dynasty.
water_of_blessed_mantle_desc: By soaking the Blessed Mantle in rose water, it is possible to infuse the Mantle's essence into potable form. This water is said to have miraculous qualities!
seal_of_mohammad_desc: This is the seal the Prophet used to sign and seal any letters sent by him, so that none would doubt the author's identity.
holy_banner_of_mohammad_desc: The Sacred Standard of the Prophet, himself, sure to instill great courage in all God-fearing men upon the battlefield.
letter_of_mohammad_desc: A letter to a foreign king, penned and signed by the Prophet Muhammad, himself.
mohammads_beard_desc: A clear glass reliquary that contains a single strand of hair from the beard of Muhammad, shaved after his death by the Prophet's favored barber.
cup_of_jamshid_desc: This golden cup, supported by a winged lion, is said to contain an elixir of immortality. It can also be used to divine deep truths both in this world and the Seven Heavens.
keshmar_cypress_branch_desc: Zoroaster, himself, planted a great cypress tree in the area of Keshmar at least a thousand years ago. The tree's magnificence and size are legendary, and these qualities can be clearly observed within this branch.
babr_e_bayan_desc: The legendary hero Rostam's dark leopard-skin coat. Worn above a suit of armor, it is said to be impervious to harm from weapons, fire, and water.
haoma_sapling_desc: A sapling of the divine Haoma bush, a fragrant golden-green bush that is said to grow on mountains. It can be consumed to aid healing, physical strength, alertness and awareness, and the cravings of the flesh.
mjolnir_desc: A strangely short-hafted hammer that looks as if it might have been flawed during production. It bears a striking resemblance to the hammer wielded by Thor, the Thundergod, as told in myth.
andvaranaut_desc: This beautiful golden ring seems to make wealth flood to its owner, though all know Andvari's Curse draws ever closer...
gjallarhorn_desc: This magnificent horn produces an unmatched volume when blown. It matches closely the description of Heimdall's Gjallarhorn in myth.
fetish_of_souls_desc: A piece of bark that has grown into the shape of a trio of visages. The trio's unsettling gazes pierce one's soul, almost as if some form of spirit still remains behind their eyes...
sampo_desc: A strangely well-crafted quern, bearing a striking resemblance to the Mill of Fortune. It is said to be able to produce gold, flour and salt from nothing at all.
axe_of_perun_desc: This exquisite bearded axe is adorned with the symbol of Perun himself: a lightning bolt. It seems to be the Thundergod's very own weapon!
yada_tashy_desc: This strange and beautiful stone is said to be able to summon rain. A prosperous harvest is all but assured for its holder!
EVTDESC_MNM_9815: The voices that have plagued me recently have begun to recede. Those who are close to me have told me they thought me possessed by a demon of sorts... But no more! What little voices remain seem to disappear whenever I clutch Solomon's ring. Perhaps it truly does hold power over demons?
EVTOPTA_MNM_9815: No demon shall hold sway over me!
EVTOPTB_MNM_9815: Alas! It was just a brief interval of lucidity...
EVTDESC_MNM_9816: Since I possess the Blessed Mantle, it would certainly be possible to instill a portion of the Mantle's power into drinkable form. This could be done through a ritual involving soaking the garment in an infusion of rose water, and catching the water that is wrung from it in bottles. To do it right, the ritual would have to be quite expensive, however...
EVTOPTA_MNM_9816: This sounds like an excellent idea!
loot_axe_desc: This mysterious axe has a purple sheen, and has the strange symbols '+' and '2' engraved in the handle. It seems to be of quite... epic... workmanship, compared to regular weaponry.
strange_chest_desc: This strange chest has been made out of an unknown type of metal. Despite not being able to open it, you can clearly tell the chest is not empty.
EVTOPTB_TOG_3300: This aberration of a weapon must be destroyed!
necronomicon_desc: A mysterious book dealing about the strange spheres beyond. Many strange and unholy truths are recorded on its pages...
finger_of_st_john_desc: A finger belonging to St. John the Baptist. St. John was a prophet of the Messiah, and was also the one to baptize Jesus.
famous_head_desc: The venerated head of a [This.GetArtifactSource]. It once contained great wisdom.
famous_tongue_desc: The venerated tongue of a [This.GetArtifactSource]. It once spoke many eloquent truths.
infamous_tongue_desc: The despised tongue of a foul unbeliever. It once spread lies and deceit.
famous_hand_desc: The venerated hand of a [This.GetArtifactSource]. It once held mighty weapons, winning him great victories.
famous_arm_desc: The venerated arm of a [This.GetArtifactSource]. It once held a scepter in just rule.
famous_foot_desc: The venerated foot of a [This.GetArtifactSource]. It once bore him on many long travels.
famous_ancient_weapon_desc: An ancient, but rusty weapon. It once belonged to a great hero, but is now only fit for display in a collection.
chains_of_st_peter_desc: The chains that held St. Peter in Herod's dungeon, until the saint was released and led to freedom by an angel.
right_hand_st_demetrius_desc: The right hand of St. Demetrius of Thessaloniki, one of the patron saints of Crusades. He blessed Nestor so the man might defeat the pagan giant Lyaios, for which both were executed.
veil_of_veronica_desc: The cloth used to wipe Jesus' face clear of blood and sweat. The Sudarium still bears the image of the face of Jesus Christ.
image_of_edessa_desc: A piece of cloth on which the face of Jesus was imprinted. King Abgar of Edessa received it from Christ to cure him of an illness.
remains_of_st_cessianus_desc: A small box containing the bones of a child. They belong to Cessianus, who was murdered at the age of eight during the persecutions of Roman Emperor Diocletian.
weeping_statue_desc: A statue of the Virgin Mary. Every now and then, a drop of water or even blood will trickle down from the statue's eyes, in what can only be described as a miracle.
EVTDESC_MNM_9835: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved head. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! Perhaps it might bestow upon me some of the wisdom it once contained?
EVTDESC_MNM_9836: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved tongue. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! Perhaps it might bestow upon me some of the eloquence it once possessed?
EVTDESC_MNM_9837: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved tongue. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to an infamous unbeliever! Perhaps it might bestow upon me some of penchant for deceit its owner once possessed?
EVTDESC_MNM_9838: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved hand. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! Perhaps it might guide my hand when next I find myself in battle?
EVTDESC_MNM_9839: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved arm. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! Perhaps it might bestow upon me some of the knowledge of statecraft its owner once possessed?
EVTDESC_MNM_9840: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a well-preserved foot. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! It helped its owner to travel far and wide, but now it will go nicely in my collection...
EVTDESC_MNM_9841: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an ancient, rusty sword. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once belonged to a [This.GetArtifactSource]! By adding it to my collection, it will surely make me the envy of the known world!
EVTDESC_MNM_9842: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box within which lie a pair of ancient iron manacles and chains. These, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, once held Saint Peter in Herod's dungeon!
EVTDESC_MNM_9843: [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small metal box. Inside lies a mummified hand, which my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] claims belonged to Saint Demetrius!
EVTDESC_MNM_9844: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a richly-decorated frame, containing a piece of cloth with a clear outline of a face. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], this is the cloth used by Veronica to wipe the blood and sweat from Jesus' face as he bore the cross!
EVTDESC_MNM_9845: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an old metal box. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that the bones within it once belonged to St. Cessianus, who was martyred in Diocletian's Great Persecution.
EVTDESC_MNM_9846: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a beautiful wooden statue of the Virgin Mary. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] claims that every so often, the statue miraculously cries tears of water or even blood!
EVTDESC_MNM_9847: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a richly-decorated frame, containing a piece of cloth with a clear outline of a face. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], this is the miraculous image of Jesus sent by Christ to King Abgar of Edessa to cure him of an illness!
cloak_of_mohammad_desc: A cloak that has been worn by the Prophet Mohammad. This alone is reason enough to accord it a shrine of the highest importance!
EVTDESC_MNM_9848: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me an old, but beautifully-made cloak. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], it was worn by the Prophet, himself! Showing it to the populace at times of unrest might well help calm them down...
tooth_of_mohammad_desc: A tooth that once belonged to Mohammad. It was lost when the Prophet was struck by a battle axe at the Battle of Uhud.
EVTDESC_MNM_9849: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a tiny wooden box, containing a piece of cloth within which lies a single human tooth. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], this is one of the four teeth Mohammad lost at the Battle of Uhud!
mohammads_bowl_desc: The bowl from which Mohammad drank soup prepared by his first wife Khadija.
blessed_sandals_desc: The Prophet's sandals, said to bestow Mohammad's blessings on those who touch them.
EVTDESC_MNM_9850: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a simple bowl. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] claims that it is the very bowl from which the Prophet ate soup!
EVTDESC_MNM_9851: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a pair of very old sandals. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that they were once worn by the Prophet, himself! It is said they still bestow Mohammad's blessings upon those who touch them...
cyrus_cylinder_desc: A clay cylinder praising the Persian King Cyrus as the rightful conqueror and benefactor of Babylon, and describing how he rebuilt its walls, temples and sanctuaries. An inspiration for all Persian rulers!
EVTDESC_MNM_9852: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an ancient clay cylinder, covered in inscriptions. When translated, they speak of King Cyrus's rightful conquest of the city of Babylon, and how he was a great benefactor of the Babylonian people. Being a Persian ruler, like Cyrus, this is welcome reinforcement of my right to rule!
tabernacle_desc: A portable tent and place of worship that served the Israelites from the time of the Exodus to their conquest of the Promised Land.
davids_sling_desc: The sling that King David used to fell the giant Goliath in personal combat.
EVTDESC_MNM_9853: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an large wagon willed in ancient cloth and poles. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] claims that this is the famed Tabernacle that our ancestors used on their way to the Promised Land!
EVTDESC_MNM_9854: Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me a small wooden box, containing a well-made leather sling. According to my [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], this is the very sling King David used to defeat Goliath!
EVTDESC_MNM_9903: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the underhanded [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find and steal one of my prized possessions!
EVTOPTB_MNM_9906: One less imitation to worry about!
EVTOPTC_MNM_9906: Excellent. It will go nicely in my collection.
EVTDESC_MNM_9907_A: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the dastardly [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find and steal a priceless relic!
EVTDESC_MNM_9907_B: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the dastardly [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find priceless relic. [looter.GetFirstName], however, claims it was an imitation, and had it destroyed!
EVTDESC_MNM_9907_C: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the dastardly [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find a priceless relic, and it is now in the hands of foul barbarians!
EVTDESC_MNM_9907_D: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the dastardly [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find priceless relic. The honorless barbarian scum promptly had it destroyed!
EVTOPTB_MNM_9907: But... It was clear mine was the original!
EVTOPTD_MNM_9907: Have they no respect for the divine?!
EVTOPTA_MNM_9910: At last it is held by someone who is truly worthy!
EVTOPTB_MNM_9910: This heretical imitation will no longer plague the world!
EVTOPTC_MNM_9910: It will become the centerpiece of my collection!
EVTOPTD_MNM_9910: Let it be known that I am the scourge of the [original_item_owner.Religion.TrueReligion.GetName] world!
EVTDESC_MNM_9911_A: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the despicable [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find and steal one of my great artifacts of [original_item_owner.Religion.GetName]!
EVTDESC_MNM_9911_B: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the dastardly [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find one of my great artifacts of [original_item_owner.Religion.GetName]. [looter.GetFirstName], however, claims it was an imitation, and had it destroyed!
EVTDESC_MNM_9911_C: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the despicable [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find and steal one of my great artifacts of [original_item_owner.Religion.GetName]! [original_item_owner.Religion.GetHighGodName] knows what blasphemy they now subject it to...
EVTDESC_MNM_9911_D: Laying waste to [target_title.GetName] [target_title.GetHolding] in [target_location.GetName] wasn't enough for the despicable [looter.GetTitledFirstName]... [looter.GetHerHisCap]'s troops also managed to find one of my great artifacts of [original_item_owner.Religion.GetName]... The honorless barbarian scum promptly had it destroyed!
EVTOPTA_MNM_9911: How dare the bastard tarnish it with [looter.GetHerHis] unworthy hands?!
EVTOPTD_MNM_9911: This is an affront to all of [original_item_owner.Religion.GetName]!
EVTDESC_RoI.249: As things have settled down a bit after you inherited your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s realm, you decide to enter the treasury and see what [cursed_diamond_parent.GetSheHe] has left for you. Sadly, you find that [cursed_diamond_parent.GetHerHis] famous diamond is gone! Someone must have stolen it while you were preoccupied with the transition of power.
EVTOPTA_RoI.249: Drat! I suppose I will never find it again...
corrupt_priest_not_recently_attempted: Has not attempted to corrupt §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! the past §Y10§! years\n
EVTDESC_MNM_4435: There are a few monasteries close by, where the lay members of [Root.Society.GetName] frequently convene. As such, it is expected that I every so often attend these meetings, and that I spend a fair amount of time at these monasteries to get in touch with the monastic foundations of the order. Such a period is about to start.
EVTOPTA_MNM_4435: I will fulfill my duties, as expected.
EVTDESC_MNM_4437: I have now been at the monastery for a few days, surrounded by others who share my passion for [monastic_befriender.Religion.GetHighGodName]. And yet, I still find I miss having a friend. [monastic_friend.GetSocietyRank] [monastic_friend.GetFirstName] and myself seem to be getting along quite well, though... Perhaps this could blossom into a true friendship if we did something together? I'm sure [monastic_friend.GetSheHe] would greatly enjoy...
EVTOPTC_MNM_4437: ...discussing the intricacies of managing a realm.
EVTOPTD_MNM_4437: ...taking a stroll and simply enjoying some small talk.
EVTDESC_MNM_4439: [monastic_friend.GetTitledFirstName] truly enjoyed my suggestion, and we have become close friends! We regularly seek each other out during our free time, and I am starting to notice that it affects my focus on my monastic duties...
EVTOPTA_MNM_4439: Let's focus on my duties. It is why I am here, after all.
EVTDESC_MNM_4441: Spending time in the monastery all day, alongside my friend [monastic_friend.GetTitledFirstName], I am sometimes overcome with sinful cravings of the flesh... It is surely simply the lack of [monastic_befriender.GetMenWomenPreference] around here! I suspect that [monastic_friend.GetFirstName] is also plagued by this.
monastic_may_become_friends: If §Y[monastic_friend.GetTitledFirstName]§! enjoys this activity, this might lead to a friendship. Perhaps if it related to [monastic_friend.GetHerHis] education...?\n
monastic_may_lead_to_more: What is the harm? It is not as if we are doing anything... Unnatural.\n
played_strategy_game_desc: This character has engaged in a game of military thinking with a friend.
discussed_scripture_desc: This character discussed the holy text with a friend.
discussed_realm_management_desc: This character discussed the intricacies of realm management with a friend.
took_stroll_small_talk_desc: This character practiced small talk with a friend.
focused_on_monastic_studies_desc: This character has focused hard on his monastic studies, while spending time visiting [From.GetHerHis] monastic order.
EVTDESC_MNM_4443: Though we had a good time, it doesn't seem that [monastic_friend.GetSocietyRank] [monastic_friend.GetFirstName] was too enamored with the activity I suggested... It's doubtful the seeds of our friendship will grow any further, after all.
caught_red_handed_desc: This character was caught attempting a theft. [GetSheHeCap] does not seem to be as sneaky as [GetSheHe] thinks [GetSheHe] is.
caught_stealing_artifact_penance_desc: This character is doing public penance for an attempted theft.
artifact_patron_desc: This character has selflessly used their personal wealth to fund a celebration in honor of a monastery's relic.
EVTDESC_MNM_4610: Visiting the monastery at which my order has convened this time, I join my fellow lay members in dutifully performing all tasks required of us. In the evening, after the day's hard work, the Abbot gathers all of the visiting lay members, and reveals the monastery's great treasure: a great relic that has been safeguarded here for many generations!
EVTOPTB_MNM_4610: Let us celebrate its glory! I'm paying!
EVTOPTB_MNM_4610_TT: This will likely please everyone in the order.\n
EVTDESC_MNM_4611: Having decided that the relic would be much better 'safeguarded' in my own hands, I must now tackle the task of how to 'liberate' it from the confines of the monastery. I can think of a few different paths to take...
EVTOPTA_MNM_4611_TT: Though bold and simple, simply waiting for nobody to be looking and then running as fast as possible is not likely to result in success...\n
EVTOPTB_MNM_4611_TT: Bribing the Abbot to ensure nobody is around would be almost guaranteed to succeed. He is, however, just as guaranteed to have a high price...\n
